meanings.definition: To reduce the pressure in a confined space.
meanings.sent1: Remember to depressurize the balloon slowly to avoid popping it.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic had to depressurize the tire before fixing the puncture.
meanings.sent3: Trying to depressurize a soda can by shaking it vigorously is not a good idea.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to depressurize her mind after a long day at work.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to quickly depressurize the airlock to exit the spacecraft.

meanings.definition: To release pressure from a system or container.
meanings.sent1: Before opening the lid, make sure to depressurize the pressure cooker.
meanings.sent2: The safety valve automatically depressurized the steam boiler when it reached a critical level.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a dramatic moment where he had to depressurize a sealed box.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to depressurize the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The emergency protocol required the crew to depressurize the fuel tank to prevent an explosion.
